Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    Player class will hold an ArrayList of Piece. This will represent the player's hand. Players will drop pieces from their hand onto the board. Player will also hold a char color to indicate which player it is. Player class will allow the player to hold the pieces they have captured and to drop those pieces onto the board. It will be initialized with the 23 pieces each player starts out with and they will each have the color of their respective players.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player(char c)
      Player constructor takes in a char to differentiate which player it is, black or white.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(char c)
        Player constructor takes in a char to differentiate which player it is, black or white. The constructor will automatically generate the 23 pieces and add them to their hands.
        Parameters:
        c - color to represent each player (white or black)

    • Method Detail

      • addToHand

        public void addToHand(Piece p)
        Adds the piece to the player's hand
        Parameters:
        p - Piece

      • captureAbove

        public void captureAbove(Tower tower,
                         int pos)
        Function will take in a tower and position. The tower must be a tower that contains pieces that belong to both players. pos is the position of the piece belonging to the player that is attacking. The function will capture the piece directly above, since immobile strike can only target pieces directly above or below.
        Parameters:
        tower - the tower that holds the two different player pieces
        pos - position of piece in tower belonging to attacking player

      • captureBelow

        public void captureBelow(Tower tower,
                         int pos)
        Same as captureAbove() except it will target the piece blow instead. Must be different colors.
        Parameters:
        tower - the tower that holds the two different player pieces
        pos - position of piece in tower belonging to attacking player

      • capturePiece

        public void capturePiece(Tower attacker,
                         Tower attacked)
        Takes the attacked tower's top piece and adds it to the attacker's hand, then moves the attacking piece to the top of the attacked tower.
        Parameters:
        attacker - Attacking piece
        attacked - Targeted piece

      • rangedCapture

        public void rangedCapture(Tower attacker,
                          Tower attacked)
        Special capture function for ranged units. The attacked piece is added to the attackers hand, but the attacker's piece doesn't move to the location where the captured piece was
        Parameters:
        attacker - the tower that holds the attacking player
        attacked - target tower

      • getPiece

        public Piece getPiece(int pos)
        returns the piece at the specified position in the hand
        Parameters:
        pos - position in hand
        Returns:
        piece at position

      • reclaimEffect

        public void reclaimEffect(int i)
        Reduces score by i
        Parameters:
        i - number

      • removePiece

        public Piece removePiece(int pos)
        removes the piece at hand position and returns it
        Parameters:
        pos - position in hand
        Returns:
        piece at position

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        returns current hand size
        Returns:
        current hand size

      • getColor

        public char getColor()
        Returns player's color (a char)
        Returns:
        color.

      • getScore

        public int getScore()
        returns value of player's score
        Returns:
        score

      • printHand

        public void printHand()
        printHand() will display what pieces the player currently has. Will use the same formatting as Board's printBoard(). Each piece will be represented by a String character.

      • checkHandComm

        public java.lang.Boolean checkHandComm()
        Use this function to check when a player has successfully captured the enemy's commander. Will be called at the end of each player's turn. Then when it returns true, the game ends and the victor is declared.
        Returns:
        Boolean, true if player holds enemy commander, false if no.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string of a player's color
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
